titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Video Recordings, 1976-1992
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Bewley.

publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library
publicationstmt.p: © 2016. State University of New York at Buffalo. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by John Bewley, 2016.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Video Recordings, 1976-1992
did.langmaterial: Collection contains spoken word content in English, Norwegian, French, and Japanese.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The collection contains thirty-one video and eight audio recordings on video cassettes, most with Yvar Mikhashoff present as performer. One video title is missing, represented only by photocopied leaves of the container.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Video Recordings,1976-1992, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of the estate of Yvar Mikhashoff, 1993.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available
altformavail.p: The collection was digitally reformatted in 2015. The funds for the reformatting were generously supplied by the Yvar Mikhashoff Trust for New Music.

Reformatting consisted of transfer to DVDs for the video content and CDs for the audio content. It also resulted in digital files formatted as preservation archival masters, production maters, and service copies. All digital files are stored in the UB Institutional Repository along with the metadata files created through the reformatting process.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Yvar-Emilian Mikhashoff was born Ronald MacKay in Troy near Albany, New York in 1941. He began piano studies with Betty Weir and Stanley Hummel in Albany. At the Eastman School of Music in 1959, he first took a major in composition and cello, then changed to piano studies with Armand Basile. In the 1961 academic year, he studied piano at the Juilliard School in New York City. He also had a career as a ballroom dancer from 1962-1965.

In 1964 Mikhashoff entered the University of Houston for studies in piano with Albert Hirsh. He earned a B.M. in 1967 and continued with graduate study in composition with Elmer Schoettle and obtained his M.M. in 1968. It was during this period that MacKay adopted his grandfather's name, Mikhashoff.

Receiving a Fulbright scholarship in 1968, he studied the music of the French Impressionists with Nadia Boulanger. After his return to the United States, Mikhashoff entered the University of Texas at Austin as a doctoral candidate in composition and studied with Hunter Johnson, Kent Kennan, Janet McGaughey and Karl Korte. He earned a Doctor of Musical Arts degree with a major in composition and a minor in literature in August 1973 and founded the Cambiata Soloists ensemble. In the fall of 1973 Mikhashoff was appointed Assistant Professor in the Music Department at the State University of New York at Buffalo. Based in Buffalo until his death in 1993, Mikhashoff had an international performing career which led him to promote new music and American music around the world.

Mikhashoff had a genius for programming, a talent he utilized extensively while organizing many festivals and broadcasts of new music throughout the world, including his work at the Almeida Festival in London and the Holland Festival. Mikhashoff co-founded the North American New Music Festival in 1983 with Jan Williams and remained a co-director until his death. He commissioned works from such notable composers as John Cage, Lukas Foss, Otto Luening, Poul Ruders, James Sellars, Christian Wolff, and many others. One of his most notable commissioning projects occurred in 1982 when he commissioned or solicited new tangos for solo piano from an international array of more than 80 composers. Mikhashoff also edited publications of music, including works by Henry Cowell, Lejaren Hiller, Conlon Nancarrow, and Virgil Thomson. He recorded on the New Albion, Mode, RCA Victor, CRI, and Spectrum record labels. Yvar Mikhashoff's support of contemporary music continues today through the Yvar Mikhashoff Trust for New Music which was created by his estate to support composers and performers of new music.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains thirty-one video and eight audio recordings. The contents are a mix of Mikhashoff's own performances, compilations in which Mikhashoff performs only a part of the whole, thirteen tapes of concerts given at the North American New Music Festival (Buffalo, New York), tapes sent to Mikhashoff by other performers or composers, and films by Lawrence Brose. The eight cassettes containing only audio are from recording sessions in Norway.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged as originally processed.

did.unittitle: Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Video Recordings, Item 1, 22 June 1976

note.p: Title on container: Theatre piece - John Cage
Live performance of John Cage's Theatre piece as produced by William Kirkpatrick.
Recorded at unknown location.
Performers: William Kirkpatrick dancer and director, and others, possibly Yvar Mikhashoff and Frances Marie Uitti
Durations: 23:18
Not very good quality. Stationary camera from a bit of a distance.

scopecontent.p: Contents: Cage, John: Theatre piece

did.unittitle: Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Video Recordings, Item 3, September 1985

note.p: Title on container: 1985 NOS - Ijsbreker

Nederlandse Omroep Stichting (NOS) television broadcast directed by Klaas Rusticus, titled De Ysbreker about the Ijsbreker festival in Amsterdam. It includes interviews with director Jan Wolff and composer Louis Andriessen, with studio performances of music by Heppener, Veldhoen, Nancarrow, and Glass. Spoken word by Wolff and Andriessen in Dutch.
Recorded at Amsterdam (Netherlands).
Durations: 1:00:01
Label on tape: NTSC

scopecontent.p: Contents: Contents include: Heppener, Robert: Memento; Veldhoen, David: Eidofoon; Davies, Hugh: Shozyg sequence, no. 2; Nancarrow, Conlon: Tango? ; Glass, Philip: Modern love waltz

did.unittitle: Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Video Recordings, Item 6, June 1987

note.p: Title on container: Vienna Now BBC Program, June 1987

BBC TV: Vienna Now. Likely the following about the Almeida Festival, from a BBC description: Vienna Now: Introductory Film Every summer, the Almeida Theatre in Islington plays host to one of Europe's most adventurous music festivals. This year its main theme is the music of Vienna today, and the city's leading composers, Friedrich Cerha, Kurt Schwertsik and Heinz Karl Gruber, are in residence at the theatre. Despite its reputation for conservatism, Vienna was the crucible for many of the 20th century's most radical developments in music and the arts. Michael Berkeley explores the appealing and often ironic sounds of Vienna today with some of its most important artistic figures. Executive producer Dennis Marks, Producer Peter Maniura, Director Jane Walker
Recorded at London (England).
Performers: Yvar Mikhashoff, piano, and many others
Duplicate of 007. Technical issues prevented digitizing.

scopecontent.p: Contents: Contents include excerpts from works by Hanns Eisler (Massnahme), Friedrich Cerha (Elegie, Keintate), Kurt Schwertsik (Rumba, Horn trio, Kurze Geschichte der Bourgeoisie) and Heinz Karl Gruber (Frankenstein).

altformavail.p: Digitized copies: Not reformatted

did.unittitle: Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Video Recordings, Item 7, June 1987

note.p: Title on container: 1987 BBC TV - Vienna Now (2) (NTSC)

Almeida Festival: Vienna now. Introduced by Michael Berkeley. BBC TV production about the June 1987 Almeida Festival, with interviews with Pierre Audi, artistic director of the festival, and guest composers, Friedrich Cerha, Kurt Schwertsik and Heinz Karl Gruber. Executive producer Dennis Marks, producer Peter Maniura, director Jane Walker. Includes excerpts from interview with Pierre Audi. Kurt Schwertsik Tango performed by Mikhashoff. Presents History of 20th century music in Vienna, with historical footage.
Recorded at London (England).
Performers: Yvar Mikhashoff, piano and many others
Durations: 26:43
NTSC format
Includes Mikhashoff performing Cerha's Elegie at ca. 10:05. English subtitled for German interviews.

scopecontent.p: Contents: Contents include excerpts from works by Hanns Eisler (Massnahme), Friedrich Cerha (Elegie, Keintate), Kurt Schwertsik (Rumba, Horn trio, Kurze Geschichte der Bourgeoisie) and Heinz Karl Gruber (Frankenstein).

did.unittitle: Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Video Recordings, Item 38, 1986

note.p: Title on container: West Coast Story Episode 1: Frontiers of New Music

Film produced by Eva Soltes and directed by Michael McIntyre for BBC, a three-part program about California composers. BBC's summary: This film tells the story of the development of west coast music in this century, against the background of the Californian landscape, the Asian communities of San Francisco and the cybernetic paradise of Silicon valley.
Recorded at Multiple locations.

Performers: John Chowning, Garrett Bowles, Rinde Eckert, Ron George, Jerry Goldsmith, Joe Kubera, Yvar Mikhashoff, Danlee Mitchell, Doren Nelson, Pauline Oliveros, Steve Reich, Roger Reynolds, Dave Whittaker; directed by Michael Macintyre
Durations: 1:15:09

scopecontent.p: Contents: With contributions from John Cage, Terry Riley, John Adams, Lou Harrison, Frank Zappa, Charles Amirkhanian, Robert Erickson, Paul Dresher, Daniel Lentz, and Morton Subotnick

note.p: Title on container: VOX - Festspillene
A film by NRK (Norsk rikskringkasting AS - Norwegian Broadcasting Company) containing excerpts from the festival, Bergen 1987.
Recorded at Bergen (Norway).
Performers: Performers include Yvar Mikhashoff, piano; Knut Skram, Benedicte Adrian, Ingrid Bjornov, singers; Daniel Bohr, festival director
Durations: 50:29

scopecontent.p: Contents include John Cage's Perpetual tango, African drumming, and more

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Resources in the Music Library

defitem.item:
The Yvar Mikhashoff Archive consists of the following separate components. Descriptions can be found at the page for the Yvar Mikhashoff Archive at http://library.buffalo.edu/music/special-materials/yvar-mikhashoff/:
Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Compositions
Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Transcriptions
Yvar Mikhashoff Photograph Collection
Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Tangos
Yvar Mikhashoff Collection of Sound Recordings
Yvar Mikhashoff Cassette Collection
Yvar Mikhashoff Slide Collection
